criteria: Understanding Relative Sizes of Measurement Units
Recording Measurement Equivalents in a Table
descriptions: Student does not demonstrate understanding of relative sizes of measurement units.
Student demonstrates minimal understanding of relative sizes of measurement units, with significant errors.
Student demonstrates partial understanding of relative sizes of measurement units, with some errors.
Student demonstrates adequate understanding of relative sizes of measurement units, with minor errors.
Student demonstrates strong understanding of relative sizes of measurement units, with minimal errors.
Student demonstrates excellent understanding of relative sizes of measurement units with no errors.  Student is able to explain reasoning.
Student is unable to convert measurements from a larger unit to a smaller unit.
Student attempts to convert measurements but makes significant errors, demonstrating a lack of understanding of the process.
Student converts measurements with some errors, showing partial understanding of the conversion process.
Student converts measurements accurately in most cases, with only minor errors.
Student consistently converts measurements accurately and efficiently.
Student flawlessly converts measurements accurately and efficiently and can articulate the conversion process.
Student does not record measurement equivalents in a two-column table or the table is completely inaccurate.
Student attempts to record measurement equivalents in a table, but the table contains many errors and omissions.
Student records some measurement equivalents in a table, but there are noticeable errors or omissions.
Student accurately records most measurement equivalents in a table with only minor errors.
Student accurately and completely records measurement equivalents in a well-organized table.
Student accurately, completely, and clearly records measurement equivalents in a well-organized table.  The student provides clear labels and headings.
Student is unable to apply measurement concepts to solve problems.
Student attempts to solve problems involving measurement but is unsuccessful and demonstrates little understanding of how to apply the concepts.
Student attempts to solve problems but makes significant errors in applying measurement concepts.
Student solves problems involving measurement with some accuracy but may struggle with more complex problems.
Student solves problems involving measurement accurately and demonstrates a good understanding of how to apply the concepts.
Student solves complex problems involving measurement accurately and demonstrates a deep understanding of how to apply the concepts. Student can explain their problem solving strategy.
